body.p:
8
Feby 11th 5
Hon. W. L. Botts
Chairman Comn on Finance
Kentucky Senate.
Sir
In obedience to a resolution of the Senate transmitted to me by you, as Chairman of the Finance Committee, I have the honor to submit the following statement, viz

I. My salary is two hundred dollars per month paid by authority of an act of the General Assembly of Ky, Entitled, "An act to fix the salaries of the Adjutant and Quarter Master Generals". Approved January the 8th 1863.

II. There are at present employed by me, six clerks with salaries per month as follows, viz
John B. Tilford Jr Act Asst Adj Genl. $125.00
Charles Hayden
120.00
Wm E. Cox
91.66
Chas J. Clarke
83.33
Tho N. Lindsey Jr
66.66
9
Wm Stewart
$83.33.

The above list includes all the clerks Employed in the Adjutant and Inspector Generals offices. They enter upon their duties at 8 oclock A. M each day, and are required to remain until 10 oclock P. M, and later if the pressure of business demands their attendance:

III. The building which I occupy as an office in conjunction with the Quarter Master General is rented at $500 -- per annum. The expenses incurred for fuel, stationary, servant hire &c, will amount on an average to $150 -- per month, which is paid by certificate to the Auditor of Public Accounts, as per authority of an act of the General Assembly, Entitled, "an Act to define further the duties of Quarter Master General" approved February 19th 1864.

IV. In addition to the Expenses above Enumerated, at times when regiments are awaiting muster out, and require copies of their original muster in rolls, I employ additional clerks for the time being, in order to facilitate their muster out. This expense however, does not occur often, and the amount thus expended will not exceed
10
on an average $25 -- per month.

The clerks Employed in this Department, are all experienced in their business, and from the fact that their whole time is required, frequently working all night, justifies the payment of good salaries. The salaries of all clerks are paid out of the Military Fund, and no clerk is Employed or salaries paid Except on approval of the Governor. Duplicate accounts are regularly made and forwarded to the War Departments, and it is Expected the General Government will reimburse for all Expenses, as on its action, the necessity for placing our State Military Departments on a War footing, has occurred. This expectation is based upon a knowledge of the facts, that similar expenses are reimbursed our neighboring states by the War Department.

Very Respectfully
D, W, Lindsey
Inspt & Adj Genl of Ky
